Pre-Game Insights: The Charlotte Hornets are heavy, 15.5-point underdogs as they try to break a nine-game losing streak when they visit the Cleveland Cavaliers on January 5, 2025.
The Cavaliers have a win probability of 88.8% according to numberFire.
The Cavaliers are 25-9-0 against the spread this season, while the Hornets are 15-16-2 against the spread.
Cavaliers games have finished with a final combined score above the over/under 22 times out of 33 chances this season.
Hornets games this year have hit the over on 12 of 33 set point totals (36.4%).
Cleveland has covered the spread in a higher percentage of its home games than away games, covering 14 times in 18 opportunities at home.
In terms of point totals, the Cavaliers hit the over more often at home, going over the total 12 times in 18 opportunities this season (66.7%).
Against the spread, Charlotte has had better results away (8-7-0) than at home (7-9-2).
In terms of the over/under, Hornets games have gone over five of 18 times at home (27.8%), and seven of 15 on the road (46.7%).
